root.content: CRITICAL ARCHITECTURAL INVESTIGATION: Time-stale filtering is meaningless without entity relationships. Investigating schema definitions, FK constraints, and relationship gaps across all entities.

children.content: ENTITY RELATIONSHIP ANALYSIS COMPLETE: Mapped SESSION, TASK, MEM, HIERARCHY entities. Found 6 critical FK gaps: (1) Mem→Task broken (UUID vs sequential IDs), (2) Mem→Session missing, (3) Trajectory→Tasks empty, (4) Brain→Everything disconnected, (5) Hierarchy→Session missing, (6) Session manifest broken. Root cause: No proper FK constraints, time-stale filtering meaningless without entity lineage.

PROPOSING FIX: 4-phase remediation plan - (1) Fix task ID mismatch (sequential→UUID), (2) Add missing FK fields (session_id to mems, trajectory_id to brain), (3) Implement EntityRelationChain service, (4) Rewrite staleness logic with proper entity lineage.

CREATING DETAILED PHASED REMEDIATION PLAN for Entity Relationship Model. Task IDs sequential→UUID, FK constraints, EntityRelationChain service, staleness rewrite. Need proper planning document before implementation.

ACKNOWLEDGED interrupted subagent cycle. Refocusing on unified architecture plan: map hook/tool retrieval automation, session lifecycle (main/sub), SOT boundaries, and align remediation plan to GSD planning standard.
Deep architecture audit: hook retrieval automation, lifecycle coherence, and SOT boundaries with file:line evidence
Completed scanner+explore evidence collection for hook retrieval matrix, overlap risk, lifecycle model, and SOT boundaries; synthesizing P0-P2 architecture findings with file:line evidence
Researching external repo gsd-build/get-shit-done planning architecture under commands/gsd; extracting planning primitives, lifecycle, artifacts, and mapping to HiveMind.

Acknowledged prior subagent blocked/failure state; proceeding with documentation-only consolidation in docs/plans/2026-02-19-entity-relationship-remediation.md to unify entity relationship remediation, hook/tool retrieval contract, and GSD-aligned lifecycle into a single executable architecture plan.

Read-only review of docs/plans/2026-02-19-entity-relationship-remediation.md for unified master architecture plan completeness, required headings/artifacts, roadmap dependency ordering, and markdown coherence.

Completed delegated read-only review of docs/plans/2026-02-19-entity-relationship-remediation.md; all required headings/artifacts verified present, roadmap dependency ordering validated, markdown coherence confirmed.

Kick off execution from docs/plans/2026-02-19-entity-relationship-remediation.md in strict order; begin Phase 0 Step 1 (TUI/log leak cleanup + rebuild/restart checkpoint) via delegated implementation.
Researching repomix.com documentation, MCP server, and skills integration to understand capabilities for OpenCode client-side plugin integration

Subagent returned partial: remediation plan has Phase 0 gates but lacks explicit Step 1 contract details. Proceeding with delegated repository scan to derive authoritative Step 1 execution inputs before implementation.
Compiling Repomix ecosystem research report with findings from documentation, MCP server, and skills integration
Identify concrete Phase 0 Step 1 scope by scanning repository artifacts for TUI/log leak cleanup and rebuild/restart checkpoint evidence; then delegate build execution.
Derived Phase 0 Step 1 contract from authoritative artifacts; delegating build execution for log leak cleanup, baseline snapshot, and rebuild/restart verification checkpoint.

COMPLETED: Critical evaluation of Gemini's architecture proposal. Key findings: (1) Reject LLM-based codewiki - use tree-sitter compression instead, (2) Reject job queue - use existing event-bus.ts, (3) Add tiktoken + tree-sitter + secret detection, (4) 3-phase production approach: Foundation → Incremental Pipeline → Context Integration. Ready for implementation planning.
Phase 0 Step 1: baseline checkpoint, targeted log leak cleanup in src/lib and src/hooks, then post-change checkpoint verification.

Transitioning from Phase 0 Step 1 baseline investigation to architecture planning document creation. Previous subagent reported failure due to investigation scope - pivoting to synthesis task based on collected research.
Acknowledging prior blocked subagent state; switching to focused read-only review of log-leak cleanup in src/lib/planning-fs.ts, src/lib/session-swarm.ts, src/lib/graph-io.ts.
Completed delegated read-only review of log-leak cleanup in planning-fs/session-swarm/graph-io; synthesizing evidence-backed verdict from scanner and explore findings.

Re-reviewing updated log-leak cleanup in planning-fs/session-swarm/graph-io with delegated scanner+explore evidence synthesis; acknowledging prior subagent failure state and proceeding with fresh validation.

Completed read-only re-review of planning-fs/session-swarm/graph-io log-leak cleanup with delegated scanner+explore synthesis; issuing evidence-backed verdict on per-project logger cache acceptability.
Completed Phase 0 Step 1 implementation: baseline + targeted src/lib log leak cleanup + post-checkpoint verification with external code review approval.

Build subagent returned partial: targeted log-leak cleanup completed in src/lib files, but repository has pre-existing build/typecheck/test failures. Running independent validation of scope and evidence.
Status blocked acknowledged from prior subagent partial/failure. Starting independent read-only validation of Phase 0 Step 1 scope, leakage, and verification commands.

Completed architecture planning document for Native Code Intelligence Engine. Created 1,354-line document with 12 sections covering: Executive Summary, Architecture Decisions (4 key decisions), System Topology (component diagram + data flow), Phase 1-3 implementation details, Data Schemas (JSON), Integration Points (4 files to extend), Dependencies (4 new npm packages), Risk Mitigation, Success Metrics, Anti-Patterns, and 4 Appendices.
READ-ONLY independent validation of Phase 0 Step 1 implementation: scope, console leakage, verification commands, and regression assessment in src/lib and src/hooks.

Independent read-only validation completed via delegated subagent. Outcome partial: scope not strictly isolated at workspace level; targeted lib log-leak cleanup validated; build/tsc/test failures appear pre-existing and unrelated to touched lib files.

Independent validation confirms log-leak cleanup landed without regressions; Phase 0 gate remains blocked by pre-existing TS6133 and compact-purification test failures. Delegating targeted baseline stabilization before advancing to Phase 1.
Acknowledged prior blocked state; delegating targeted Phase 0 baseline stabilization for TS6133 unused constant and compact-purification regressions with full verification gates.
Phase 0 baseline stabilization: TS6133 and compact-purification regressions
Read-only code review of Phase 0 baseline stabilization changes in src/schemas/config.ts, src/lib/compaction-engine.ts, src/hooks/compaction.ts for TS6133 + compaction report safeguards
Phase 0 stabilization implemented and verified; code-review approved
Phase 0 targeted stabilization applied; build/typecheck/sdk-boundary pass, full test suite remains blocked by two pre-existing unrelated failures in messages-transform and soft-governance tests.
Read-only independent validation of Phase 0 stabilization patch: verify 3 target files and run build/typecheck/test/sdk-boundary checks.

Acknowledged prior aborted validation cycle; switching to precision mode: single delegated read-only pass to validate 3 target files and run build/typecheck/test/sdk-boundary exactly once each, then report concise evidence.
Single-pass independent validation complete: target files are surgical, build/typecheck/test/sdk-boundary all pass in one run each; Phase 0 Step 1 is green.
Acknowledged prior aborted subagent cycle; superseded by successful single-pass validation and committed atomic governance/docs snapshot.
Proceeding to Phase 1 execution in strict lean mode: extract exact contract, delegate single build implementation cycle, single code-review validation, single verification pass, atomic commit.
Phase 1 contract extracted with UUID normalization scope and gates; delegating single build implementation cycle (no nested build) with one verification pass.
Delegating single build implementation cycle for Phase 1 identity normalization (UUID lineage migration) with one-pass verification pack and no commit.
Executing Phase 1 identity normalization implementation cycle: UUID lineage migration and reference consistency, with single verification pack and no commit.
Read-only review of Phase 1 identity-normalization changes in graph-migrate/session-lifecycle/tests for scope adherence and regressions.
Build cycle returned partial: Phase 1 UUID normalization implemented in graph-migrate/session-lifecycle/tests, but verification pack failed due environment baseline (missing tsx, Node types).

Phase 1 build cycle returned partial: UUID normalization implemented in graph-migrate/session-lifecycle/tests, but verification pack blocked by environment baseline (missing tsx and Node type resolution). Status=blocked pending single review and baseline decision.

Completed read-only code review of Phase 1 UUID normalization across graph-migrate, session-lifecycle hook, and tests; preparing blocking/non-blocking findings.
Blocked: read-only Phase 1 review found hook side effects and incomplete state reference rewrite path; commit not ready
Single code-review returned BLOCK: hook side-effect migration and incomplete state active_task_id rewrite edge case. Delegating surgical blocker-fix cycle before commit.
Apply surgical blocker fixes from code-review: hook side-effect removal, guard ordering, active_task_id rewrite edge case
Applied surgical blocker fixes: removed hook normalization side-effect path, reordered config guard before migration trigger, and fixed active_task_id rewrite when tasks array missing/corrupt
Applied surgical Phase 1 blocker fixes in session-lifecycle and graph-migrate; verification command remained environment-blocked. Running final single code-review gate for commit readiness.
Performing final read-only code review of Phase 1 blocker fixes in graph-migrate, session-lifecycle, and graph-migrate tests; no edits, no test execution.
Conducting read-only diff-based final review for graph-migrate, session-lifecycle, and graph-migrate tests with no edits or test execution.
Subagent read-only review returned BLOCK: hook still calls migrateIfNeeded in session lifecycle; commit not ready.
Final review remains BLOCKED: hook still calls migrateIfNeeded in session lifecycle. Executing one surgical fix cycle to remove hook write-side migration and restore commit readiness.
Acknowledged prior blocked subagent state; applied surgical fix removing migrateIfNeeded from session lifecycle hook to keep hook read/injection-only.
Phase 1 identity normalization implemented and blockers fixed; atomic source commit created (1f7c4aa). Verification gate remains environment-blocked (tsx missing / node type resolution).
Resuming with full governance checkpoint; validating master plan alignment, checking context exports, cleaning up .hivemind state, and preparing comprehensive TODO for next execution phase.

Master plan validation COMPLETE: Phase 1 execution gap identified - normalizeTaskIdsToUuidLineage code committed but never executed on current directory; state/tasks.json still has non-UUID IDs. Executing Phase 1 re-run before Phase 2.
Executed normalizeTaskIdsToUuidLineage() successfully. Created lineage map with 13 mappings. All state/tasks.json IDs now UUID format. Zero errors.
Phase 1 identity normalization RE-EXECUTED successfully: 13 UUID mappings created, lineage map artifact generated, commit b9cb299. Proceeding with cleanup tasks and Phase 2 preparation.

CORRECTION: Acknowledged pattern violation - abandoning monolithic TODO; returning to phase-by-phase execution with proper delegation chain: extract contract → build (with scanner/explore) → code-review → atomic commit → checkpoint.
Execute entity-relationship remediation master plan in strict order with evidence gates: Phase 0 baseline/cleanup first, then identity normalization, then FK backfill/hook isolation.
